metadata.Title: CVE-2022-20132 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.Description:
In lg_probe and related functions of hid-lg.c and other USB HID files,there is a possible out of bounds read due to improper input validation.This could lead to local information disclosure if a malicious USB HIDdevice were plugged in, with no additional execution privileges needed.User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-188677105References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required
